benchmark_details.name: MATHARENA
benchmark_details.overview: MATHARENA is a dynamic publicly available benchmark designed to evaluate LLMs on uncontaminated problems sourced from recurring math competitions, targeting mathematical reasoning and proof-writing capabilities.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the mathematical reasoning capabilities of large language models using uncontaminated math competition problems.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The benchmark is limited by the number of annual competitions available.

data.source: Problems sourced from various math competitions including AIME, HMMT, USAMO, and others.
data.annotation: Problems are formatted and pre-validated for accuracy.

methodology.calculation: Accuracy is computed as the average performance across multiple model runs per problem.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better reasoning capabilities in LLMs, while the leaderboard ranks models based on their performance.
methodology.validation: Regular updates with newly released competition problems ensure the relevance and difficulty of the benchmark.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: Analysis includes performance across different types of math problems, addressing any potential biases in problem distribution.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Data is available under CC-BY-NC-SA 4.0 license for non-commercial use.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: All data releases comply with the policies of competition organizers.
